result.execSummary:
All charges against Jose E Perez in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jose E Perez is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose E Perez

records.addlTxt:
8:48 AM Defendant Jose E Perez in court, in custody.  Attorney Pablo Galaviz in court for Jose E Perez.  Prosecuting attorney Kristi J Gordon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

State has not been able to make contact with the victim or make travel arrangements for the victim, based upon that the State moves to dismiss without prejudice. 
Defense does not dismiss. 
Court will grant the motion to dismiss without prejudice. Defendant to be released on this case forthwith.

Defense made a speedy trial demand on 08/27/2022 and requests a trial date. Defense consents to extend the time to set trial to 11/01/2022.Trial set.

Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W Moreland Blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 08-09-2022)

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A/Ingleside Hotel listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM . Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.
